did.abstract: The documents in this collection pertain to street names in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn and in Manhattan with notes of street name changes or alternate names of streets.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Gertrude and Yvonne Reynolds, 1969.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Henry A. Reynolds was Chief of Company Division in the Hall of Records in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Henry A. Reynolds Brooklyn and Manhattan street name records, 1978.042, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The documents in this collection pertain to street names in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn and in Manhattan with notes of street name changes or alternate names of streets. In addition, the Manhattan document gives a detailed account of "The Great Fire of September 1, 1776" and the destruction caused to lower Manhattan as a result of the fire.
